Class fractions.Fraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • fractions.Fraction

  • public class fractions.Fraction
extends java.lang.Object
    The fractions.Fraction class represents parts of a whole number

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      fractions.Fraction()
      Initialises a fractions.Fraction object to 0
      fractions.Fraction(double numerator)
      Initialises a fractions.Fraction object to represent a whole number
      fractions.Fraction(double numerator, double denominator)
      Initialises a fractions.Fraction object to represent a proper or improper fraction
      fractions.Fraction(double wholeNumber, double numerator, double denominator)
      Initialises a fractions.Fraction object to represent a mixed fraction
      fractions.Fraction(fractions.Fraction fraction)
      Initialises a fractions.Fraction object to copy another fraction

    • Method Detail

      • simplify

        public void simplify()
        Breaks a fractions.Fraction numerator and denominator to their smallest forms without a common factor

      • isSimplified

        public boolean isSimplified()
        Returns true or false depending on if the numerator and denominator of the fractions.Fraction has a common factor
        Returns:
        true if the the numerator and denominator of the fractions.Fraction have a common factor, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the fraction
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string in the form "numerator / denominator". Special case:
        • If the denominator is equal to 1, only the numerator is returned

      • convertToFraction

        public static fractions.Fraction convertToFraction(java.lang.String fractionString)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a fractions.Fraction object from a string in a fractions.Fraction format
        Parameters:
        fractionString - a string in a fraction format
        Returns:
        a fractions.Fraction object from the fractionString
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the fractionString is in an invalid format and if 0 is parsed as denominator

      • compareFractions

        public static int compareFractions(fractions.Fraction firstFraction,
                                   fractions.Fraction secondFraction)
        Compare two fractions based on their equivalent decimal forms
        Parameters:
        firstFraction - main fraction
        secondFraction - compared fraction
        Returns:
        the value 0 if the fractions are equal, a value lesser than 0 if the firstFraction is lesser than the secondFraction and a value greater than 0 if the firstFraction is greater than the secondFraction
